intro: Lomaria confusa, commonly known as the confused lomaria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Lomaria confusa is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
